newsitem.title: USA: Keystone Financial buys Financial Trust.
newsitem.headline: Keystone Financial buys Financial Trust.

text.p: Keystone Financial Inc said Thursday its shareholders approved the merger into Keystone of Financial Trust Corp of Carlisle, Penna.
Shareholders of Financial Trust will receive 1.65 shares of Keystone common stock for each of the approximately 8,496,000 outstanding Financial Trust shares, Keystone said.
The action was approved by Financial Trust shareholders May 7, Keystone said.
Financial Trust is a bank holding company with four member banks and about $1.2 billion in assets, Keystone said.
First Financial of Western Maryland shareholders also approved the acquisition of their company by Keystone at a special meeting today, Keystone said.
That transaction did not require approval by Keystone shareholders, Keystone added.
First Financial of Western Maryland is a thrift holding company with one thrift subsidiary and about $345 million in assets and operates 10 community offices in Maryland, Keystone said.

Shareholders of First Financial will receive 1.29 shares of Keystone stock for each of the about 2,124,000 outstanding First Financial shares or an equivalent value in cash, Keystone said. The mergers have been approved previously by regulatory agencies and are expected to be completed later this month, Keystone said.
